text: When we look to the individuals of the same variety or sub-variety of our older cultivated plants and animals, one of the first points which strikes us, is, that they generally differ much more from each other, than do the individuals of any one species or variety in a state of nature. When woe look Jo sh indolals el Th. sam oauily er oub-oariely of aur clee eullwasol planh and aninals,cnl e] Mi lirl peinh which Suke l,is, Nhat Nhey qlneualy elffer much mou Liem. ho jy cymomur nyy oy' uyy'mye yur On species ct uarily in a sali of. naluu
handwritten_text: When we look to the individuals of the same variety or sub-variety of our older cultivated plants and animals, one of the first points which strikes us, is, that they generally differ much more from each other, than do the individuals of any one species or variety in a state of nature.
